week_metadata.title: Probability & Statistics - Quantifying Uncertainty
week_metadata.subtitle: Master the mathematics of uncertainty and decision-making under incomplete information
week_metadata.description: Discover how probability theory enables AI systems to reason under uncertainty, make decisions with incomplete data, and quantify confidence in predictions. From spam detection to medical diagnosis, learn the mathematical tools that handle real-world messiness.
learning_objectives: Understand probability distributions and their role in modeling uncertainty
Master Bayes' theorem as the foundation of learning from evidence
Apply statistical inference to validate machine learning models
Quantify uncertainty in predictions and decision-making
Connect probability theory to real AI systems and business applications
prerequisites: Week 1: Linear algebra for multivariate distributions
Week 2: Calculus for continuous probability distributions
Basic understanding of functions and mathematical reasoning
week_metadata.historical_context: Probability theory emerged from gambling problems in the 1600s but became the foundation of modern AI. Every recommendation system, medical AI, and autonomous vehicle relies on probabilistic reasoning to handle uncertainty.
week_metadata.motivation: Perfect information is a luxury AI systems rarely have. Learn how Netflix recommends movies with incomplete data, how medical AI diagnoses with uncertainty, and how autonomous vehicles make life-critical decisions under incomplete information.

building_on_week1: Multivariate probability distributions use linear algebra concepts
Covariance matrices (Week 1) become central to multivariate normal distributions
Eigenvalues/eigenvectors appear in principal component analysis of data
Matrix operations enable efficient computation of probabilistic models
building_on_week2: Probability density functions use calculus for continuous distributions
Maximum likelihood estimation uses optimization (gradient descent)
Bayesian inference often requires numerical optimization
Statistical learning theory connects optimization to generalization
mathematical_progression: Week 1: Deterministic transformations → Week 3: Probabilistic transformations
Week 2: Optimization under certainty → Week 3: Decision-making under uncertainty
Weeks 1-2: Perfect information → Week 3: Learning from noisy, incomplete data
